text: Forget the mistakes of the past and press on to the greater achievements of the future.
Wherever you are, be there totally.
When walking, walk. When eating, eat.
The more disciplined your mind, the more aware you are of what is worth your attention.
Like a clear still pool, a calm and focused mind reflects reality as it is.
An immovable mind is not a focused mind; it is a fixed mind.
Only when you can be extremely pliable and soft can you be extremely hard and strong.
The mind is like water; when agitated, it becomes difficult to see. But if allowed to settle, the answer becomes clear.
